intro: Ceiba chodatii, commonly known as the Chodat ceiba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in a fibrous, woody capsule that splits open when mature. Ceiba chodatii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
